intro: Hedyosmum steinii, commonly known as the Brazilian star-anise, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the star anise, though it is not related to the true star anise. Hedyosmum steinii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses. Its growth is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
